Discord, Telegram, And The Dark Side Of Web2

blog/discord-in-web3.title: Discord, Telegram, And The Dark Side Of Web2
blog/discord-in-web3.description: Web3 is forging a new path, radical shifting from the centralized model to shared ownership and decentralized decision-making. And when the web3 community continues to evolve and mature, one thing becomes clear: Discord and Telegram just don't fit in anymore.

general/what-is-buidler.title: What is Buidler
general/what-is-buidler.description: Buidler is a Web3 Messaging App for your community, teams, and supporters to connect, communicate and collaborate. By perfectly combining social messaging and crypto wallet, the mission of Buidler is to make Web3 more useful for everyone and make Web3 happen.

using-buidler/connect-via-metamask-walle.title: Connect via MetaMask and WalletConnect
using-buidler/connect-via-metamask-walle.description: Currently, Buidler only supports connecting through MetaMask and WalletConnect on the browser. This feature enables you to conveniently access and manage your crypto assets within the Buidler platform.

using-buidler/connect-via-social.title: Connect via Social Login
using-buidler/connect-via-social.description: Getting started with Buidler is now easier with the integration of Web3Auth. You can now log in to your Buidler account using your existing social accounts like Google, Facebook, Apple, and Discord.

using-buidler/getting-started.title: Getting Started
using-buidler/getting-started.description: Builder is a web3 native platform, meaning your account is identified by your wallet address, not an email address, phone number, or password like in traditional web2 platforms.

using-buidler/how-to-create-wallet.title: How to create wallet with Buidler?
using-buidler/how-to-create-wallet.description: Builder is a web3 native platform that allows you to securely store, send, and receive tokens, NFTs, and cryptocurrencies. In other words, Builder is just a crypto wallet. Just download the Buidler app on iOS or macOS and follow these steps to make a new wallet:

using-buidler/how-to-import-wallet.title: How to import wallet with Buidler?
using-buidler/how-to-import-wallet.description: If you already have a wallet, you can import it to Buidler using your seed phrase or private key. This will enable you to use your existing wallet to access the Buidler platform.
